I am interested in using Junit and JXunit to create a network 
simulator. Being rather new to both Junit and JXunit I am not sure if 
this makes sense. I understand JUnit is used for unit testing but I 
was wondering If I could use it along with JXunit in creating a 
simulator.

My JUnit TC would interface with my api and allow me to enroll 
Network elements into my application. I would create my test case 
with a loop to enroll x number of Network elements. JXunit would be 
used to contain the data necessary to call my api. ie Number of NE's 
to enroll as well Network Element attributes.

Does it make sense to use Junit and JXunit.

I also want to raise alarms on my simulated NE's. But performance is 
a concern. I would want my Alarm raising test case to be able to call 
my API and raise alarms at a rate of 500 alarms per sec. Any idea how 
Junit and JXunit would handle this type of load.
